title: Around the Districts : Askamore to Carnew
body_text:
Around the Districts: Askamore to Carnew
ASKAMORE
Notes email contact
Please email notes for the paper to maryberniedoran@gmail.com
Table Quiz
Kit Kenny will once again be hosting a table quiz in aid of a childrens centre in Kenya on Friday 10th January at 8pm in Askamore Community Centre Y25F6D8. A raffle with loads of prizes will be held on the night. All proceeds are in aid of Nadirkonyen Street Childrens Centre in Kenya.
More Drama at Kilrush
More Drama at Kilrush is a second book continuing on from their 50th Anniversary edition, Drama at Kilrush. This edition is titled More Drama at Kilrush and features 29 productions by the group in the last ten years inclusive of two All Ireland Wins in 2015 and 2024.
In the same format as the first edition, it includes a fantastic record of the plays and events over these years, based on records kept by Mick Byrne (founder member of the group), accompanied by hundreds of photographs of the productions. The book also features the Pageants that the group were involved in Flight to Grosse Ile, The Coolattin Pageant and Seven Men, Seven Days both written by Davy Donohoe. Central to this publication are hundreds of colour photographs from Eamonn Doran’s collection and photographs.
Books are available from members of Kilrush Drama Committee, from Mark Kennedy in Hall’s Shop, Main Street, Carnew and from Candy’s, Carnew and are now also available in Cahill Bros Glass and Glazing, Bunclody at €20 each. There are a limited number of the first book Drama at Kilrush and you can buy the two books for €30.
Askamore Journals 5 and 6
Askamore Journals 5 and 6, over 800 pages of pictures and local farm and family information. The journals are being sold as a unit of two books telling the story of the half parish of Askamore at a price of €60. All funds go to Askamore Community Council, the local development group. Books are available from Eilish in the centre, text 0852156848, from Davy on 086 0820146 or from Candy’s shop Carnew.
New Year, New You
Four nights of stimulating talks will take place in January 2025 in Askamore Community Centre
Night 2: Tuesday January 14th at 8.30pm. Catherine McCurdy (Manager Wexford Women’s Refuge): Domestic Violence; Oisin McConville (Wicklow Footbal Manager): Gambling Addiction
Night 3: Tuesday January 21st at 7.30pm. Christopher Joyce (Coach Wicklow Football Team): Alcohol Addiction; John Kinsella, Ger Byrne and Pat Lacey (Chairman Wexford Parkinson’s Association, Parkinson’s Local Insights.
Night 4: Tuesday January 28th at 7.30pm. Catherine O’Leary and Laurence Cullen (Alzheimer’s Association):Challenges of Dementia Michael Fortune: Local Folklore, Songs from Alyth McCormack
Admission for each night is €10 or €25 for all four nights. Refreshments Served. Contact 085 2156848.
Askamore Community Council
Irish Dance Classes with the Hennigan School of Dancing have started on Wednesdays in Askamore Hall from 5.30pm to 6.30pm. All ranges from beginner to advanced welcome (from 4yrs upwards). Girls and Boys. Contact Lucy on 087 619 6590 for more details.
Bowls will take place on the first Tuesday of every month, in Askamore Community Centre at 8pm. Come along for a fun way to spend an hour or two. All are welcome including beginners, so why not give it a try. Contact Margaret on 087 7628839
Join our Gym: State of the Art Gym and full time Instructor in Askamore Community Centre. Join our 8 week exercise program starting in September, see our Metcon Fitness Facebook page. Enquiries to Colm on 085 7334076.
Pilates with Finch: Wednesday mornings 9am–10am. Enquiries to Finch on 086 8468165.
BALLYCANEW
Split the Pot
Congratulations to the Saturday January 4 winner of Split the Pot, Fionn Byrne. You won €100. Congratulations, Thanks to everyone for your continued support
St Pat’s GAA Lotto
Results of Club Lotto Draw on December 30. This week’s Jackpot €8,300. Numbers Drawn 4-16-21–23. No Jackpot Winner. One Matched 3 winner: Sheila and Brian Murphy, congratulations you win €150. Next Draw on Monday January 6. New Jackpot €8,450.
Recycling Clothing Banks
Please do not leave bags at the clothing bank if the bank is full. Bring it home and come back another day. The bank is emptied regularly.
Ballycanew National School
Ballycanew National School shall cease accepting applications for admission on 15th January.
Admissions forms are available from our school website www.ballycanewns.ie under our enrolment tab or by calling into the office. Our annual Admissions Notice 2025/2026 is available on our website along with our Admission Policy
If you, or anyone you know, might be interested in sending your child to a Ballycanew NS, Don’t hesitate to get in touch if you have any questions
Dance into 2025 with Zumba!
Zumba returns to Ballycanew National School. 6-Week Zumba Courses–Only €50 Each. Pay as you go €10.
Start Dates - Block 1: Tuesday, January 14 at 7pm. Block 2: Thursday, January 16 at 7pm. All Ages & Abilities Welcome. Unleash Your Inner Dancer!
Get ready to groove, sweat, and smile for 6 weeks of energy-packed fun and fitness! Perfect for beginners and pros alike. Come solo or bring friends.
Special Offer: Sign up for both days and get an extra discount—only €90 for 12 classes!. Spaces are limited–Sign Up NOW and kickstart your year with a burst of good energy!
Contact - Email:ainezumba@gmail.com; Insta:zumba_aine; Facebook: Zumba with Aine.
Whist Drive
Whist drive continues every Friday night at 8pm sharp in Ballycanew Parish hall. All welcome.
Small Battery Recycling Collection
Ballycanew National School are collecting batteries for the WEEE Ireland Battery Recycling competition. You may drop your used batteries to Ballycanew National School during school time.
Re-turn bottle bins
Our Re-turn bottle recycling bins have moved to their new home beside the clothes recycling bank at the front of the school.
Don’t forget to bring all your recyclable cans and bottles with the Re-turn logo to be recycled in our two big blue bins at the front of the school.
Thanks to Ballycanew Tidy Towns for all their help.
Dog walkers
If your out walking your dog, please clean up after it. It is an offence if you don’t clean up after your dog.
Local notes
If you have anything that you would like to be included in the local notes then please contact Ann on 087-7433684 or email annkehoe@yahoo.ie by 5pm on Sunday evenings.
CARNEW
GAA Lotto
Carnew GAA lotto was not won numbers were 11,12,19,22, lucky dips were Mick Kelly and David Gregan, the next draw is 13th January and the jackpot is €5,700.
Bingo
The next drive in bingo is on Sunday 19th January at 2pm in Carnew mart.
GOAL Mile
We are pleased to announce that the 10th Tinahely GOAL Mile (not the 9th as previously published!) has so far raised a fantastic €702 through online registrations and on the day donations. Thank you for your ongoing support of GOAL Global’s humanitarian work across the world.
Thank you to Sam and Colin Horan, from Murphy’s Hotel Tinahely, for their ongoing generosity in hosting the event and providing refreshments afterwards.
Special thanks also to Maeve Tallon and other members of Tinahely Comhaltas Ceoltoiri Eireann (CCÉ) for organising the musical entertainment.
It was a true community event.
Table Quiz
Kit Kenny will once again be hosting a table quiz in aid of a childrens centre in Kenya on Friday 10th January at 8pm in Askamore Community Centre Y25F6D8. A raffle with loads of prizes will be held on the night. All proceeds are in aid of Nadirkonyen Street Childrens Centre in Kenya.
New Year, New You
Four nights of stimulating talks will take place in January 2025 in Askamore Community Centre
Night 1: Tuesday January 7th at 7.30pm. Bishop Ger Nash: Kindness; Susan Byrne McDonald (Dietician) Lets get the Diet right; Ann Cushin: (Operation Transformation Participant)
Night 2: Tuesday January 14th at 8.30pm. Catherine McCurdy (Manager Wexford Women’s Refuge): Domestic Violence; Oisin McConville (Wicklow Footbal Manager): Gambling Addiction
Night 3: Tuesday January 21st at 7.30pm. Christopher Joyce (Coach Wicklow Football Team): Alcohol Addiction; John Kinsella, Ger Byrne and Pat Lacey (Chairman Wexford Parkinson’s Association, Parkinson’s Local Insights.
Night 4: Tuesday January 28th at 7.30pm. Catherine O’Leary and Laurence Cullen (Alzheimer’s Association):Challenges of Dementia Michael Fortune: Local Folklore, Songs from Alyth McCormack
Admission for each night is €10 or €25 for all four nights. Refreshments Served. Contact 085 2156848.
Join Tomnafinnoge AC
Track & Field Coaches and New Members Wanted! Are you inspired by the recent Olympic Games? Do you want to unleash your potential in track & field? Tomnafinnoge Athletics Club is recruiting across all age groups and skill levels!
We are seeking: Juveniles (8-18 years); Seniors (18+ years); Masters (35+ years).
Plus, we’re looking for Coaches with a passion for developing the next generation of athletes!
Whether you’re aiming for your personal best, the podium, or simply enjoying the sport, there’s a place for you at Tomnafinnoge Athletics Club. Training includes: Sprints, Distance running, Jumps & throws, Strength & conditioning.
All levels welcome! From beginners to experienced athletes.
Join us now and be part of something extraordinary! For more details and to register, contact us via our Facebook page or email us tomnafinnogeac@gmail.com
GAA club dinner dance
We are excited to invite you to our Dinner Dance on Saturday 11th January in the Arklow Bay Hotel, with music by Fusion, tickets €45.
We are celebrating not one, not two but eight winning teams from 2024. How many clubs can say they have eight adult trophies brought back to their club within one year?!
We are super excited to celebrate the amazing achievements that we accomplished this year from winning leagues and championships!
Our winners who will be getting their medals: Senior Hurling League, Intermediate LGFA Championship, Intermediate Football League, Intermediate Football Championship, Junior Hurling League, Junior Hurling Championship, Junior Camogie Shield, U19 Hurling Championship.
If you have yet to order your tickets please do so as soon as possible to Niamh, Aoife or Christina.
Tinahely Craft market
Tinahely Craft market will be open on Saturdays only for the month of January then business as usual. Our delicious range of biscuits will be back in stock along with all the fabulous locally produced crafts. Opening hours are 10am-4pm.
Tinahely Craft market is situated in the middle of the village opposite the butchers shop.
